transcripts.prompt: Please transcribe the text from the following image with high accuracy. Ensure that all punctuation, capitalization, and formatting are preserved as closely as possible to the original. If any part of the text is illegible or unclear, indicate this with '[illegible]' in the transcription. Pay special attention to names, dates, and any specific terminology. Please provide only the transcription.
transcripts.original_text: In the matter of the application of Mrs. Mary House widow of John House for certain arrears of pension State of New York Oneida County: Mary House being duly sworn says that the family record of John House hereunto annexed is a true and correct record of the marriage of said House to this deponent & the births of their children as kept by said House, and taken from the old family bible of said John & Mary House in the possession of the deponent that said record is genuine is in the hand writing of said John House deceased. Witness to signature R. McIntosh Mary House x her mark Sworn to and subscribed before on this 15th day of March A.D. 1853 and I hereby certify that I believe the annexed record is the true and genuine record of the marriage of John & Mary House & the births of their children. Given under my hand and seal of the [illegible] Court this 15th day of March 1853. Ralph McIntosh Special Surrogate
transcripts.extracted_text: In the matter of the application of Mrs. Mary Havens widow of John Havens for certain arrears of pension &c  State of New York Oneida County ss:  Mary Havens being duly sworn says that the family record of John Havens hereunto annex- ed is a true and correct record of the marriage of said Havens & this applicant, & of the birth of their children, as kept by said Havens and taken from the old family bible of said John & Mary Havens in the possession of this de- ponent. That said record is genuine, is in the hand wri- ting of said John Havens deceased.  Witness to adaptation 	   D M Gorton		   Mary Havens 			      her 			      mark  Sworn to and subscribed before me this 15th day of March A.D. 1853. And I hereby certify that I believe the annexed record is the true and genuine record of the Marriage of John & Mary Havens & the birth of their children.  Given under my hand and seal of the Surrogates Court this 15th day of March 1853-            [illegible] M. Groton [illegible]             Oneida Co. Surragate

transcripts.original_text: In the matter of the application of Mrs. Mary House widow of John House for certain arrears of pension State of New York Oneida County: Mary House being duly sworn says that the family record of John House hereunto annexed is a true and correct record of the marriage of said House to this deponent & the births of their children as kept by said House, and taken from the old family bible of said John & Mary House in the possession of the deponent that said record is genuine is in the hand writing of said John House deceased. Witness to signature R. McIntosh Mary House x her mark Sworn to and subscribed before on this 15th day of March A.D. 1853 and I hereby certify that I believe the annexed record is the true and genuine record of the marriage of John & Mary House & the births of their children. Given under my hand and seal of the [illegible] Court this 15th day of March 1853. Ralph McIntosh Special Surrogate
transcripts.extracted_text: In the matter of the application of Mrs Mary Haner widow of John Haner for certain arrears of pension.  State of New York Oneida County ss:  Mary Haner being duly sworn says that the family record of John Haner herewith annex- ed is a true and correct record of the marriage of said Haner to this deponent, & the births of their children, as kept by said Haner, and taken from the old family bible of said John & Mary Haner for the perpetuation of this de- posit; that said record is genuine is in the hand wri- ting of said John Haner deceased. Witness to signature [illegible] Mary Haner                           X her mark  Sworn to and subscribed before me this 15th day of March A.D. 1855. And I hereby certify that I believe the annexed record is the true and genuine record of the marriage of John & Mary Haner & the births of their children.  Given under my hand and seal of the Surrogate's Court this 15th day of March 1855. [illegible] W. Baker       Surrogate
